verses.roman:
nityānanda avadhūta sabāte āgala
caitanyera dāsya-preme ha-ilā pāgala

synonyms: nityānanda avadhūta—the mendicant Lord Nityānanda; sabāte—among all; āgala—foremost; caitanyera dāsya-preme—in the emotional ecstatic love of being a servant of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; ha-ilā pāgala—became mad.
translation: Śrī Nityānanda, the wandering mendicant, is the foremost of all the associates of Lord Caitanya. He became mad in the ecstasy of service to Lord Caitanya.
